intro: Senna pendula var. ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf senna, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It features compound leaves with oval-shaped leaflets that are arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which are typical of the Fabaceae family. Its small, pod-like fruits contain several seeds, and the plant is often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
